alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Eastern Union; Hudson (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued September 28 at 5:58AM EDT until September 29 at 11:00AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM TO 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM TO 11 AM EDT FRIDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM FRIDAY TO MIDNIGHT EDT FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the first Coastal Flood Advisory, up to 1 ft of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. For the second Coastal Flood Advisory, up to 1 ft of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. For the third Coastal Flood Advisory, up to 1 ft of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. * WHERE...Hudson, Eastern Essex and Eastern Union Counties. * WHEN...For the first Coastal Flood Advisory, from 6 PM to 10 PM EDT this evening. For the second Coastal Flood Advisory, from 7 AM to 11 AM EDT Friday. For the third Coastal Flood Advisory, from 7 PM Friday to midnight EDT Friday night. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding is expected in the most vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline during the times of high tide this evening into Friday evening. Expect up to 1 ft of inundation above ground level in low lying, vulnerable areas. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns and homes/businesses with basements near the waterfront will experience shallow flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Additional rounds of minor coastal flooding are possible during the times of high tide this weekend.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
